message: Hi Bob, I have a product that I think you'd be very interested in. It's worth a lot to you, and I'm willing to sell it for a fair price. How does $12,000 sound?
I'm interested in the product, but I was thinking more along the lines of $9,000. I'm willing to pay that price, but I'm not sure if it's worth it for me at that price point.

Bob, I appreciate your offer, but $9,000 just doesn't work for me.  How about we split the difference? I'm willing to come down to $10,500.  That's still a great deal for you, and it gives me a bit closer to what I need.
I'm still not convinced that $10,500 is the best price for me. I'm willing to meet you in the middle, but I can only go up to $10,000. Can you consider that?

Bob, I understand you're trying to get the best deal, and I appreciate that. I'm willing to come down a little more to $10,250. That's a great deal for you, and it's closer to what I need.  Let's close this deal!
I'm still not comfortable with $10,250. I'm willing to go up to $9,800, but that's my final offer. Can you meet me there?
Bob, I'm willing to meet you in the middle again. Let's settle on $10,000. That's a fair price for both of us, and it will allow us to close this deal.
I'm still trying to save some money, so I'll go up to $9,500. That's my last offer. Can you meet me there?
